title: Crew-5 launch preparations continue amid hurricane threat
summary: NASA is, for now, moving ahead with plans for a launch of the next crew to the International Space Station early next week as it watches an approaching hurricane.

title: China conducts trio of orbital launches across two days
summary: China launched eight classified remote sensing satellites across three launches in recent days, adding to the country’s development of reconnaissance capabilities.

title: NASA to Provide Media Update on Artemis I Rollback
summary: NASA will host a media teleconference at 2 p.m. EDT Tuesday, Sept. 27, to discuss the agency’s decision to roll the Artemis I Space Launch System rocket and Orion spacecraft back to the Vehicle Assembly Building (VAB) at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. Artemis I is a flight test to launch SLS and send Orion beyond the Moon and back to Earth

title: Ian reaches major hurricane status, will be a historic storm for Florida
summary: Surge, winds, rainfall—unfortunately, Hurricane Ian is going to pack quite a punch.

title: Lawmakers press Air Force for final decision on U.S. Space Command
summary: Colorado’s senators in a Sept. 27 to Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall argue that a final basing decision on U.S. Space Command needs to be made as soon as possible in light of the Ukraine conflict and China’s expansion in the Pacific

title: TransAstra and Celestron to modify telescopes for spaceflight
summary: Space logistics startup TransAstra announced an agreement Sept. 27 with telescope manufacturer Celestron to develop a space-qualified version of a popular ground-based telescope.

title: UK shortlists Astroscale and ClearSpace for multi-debris removal mission
summary: The UK Space Agency said Sept. 26 it has shortlisted groups led by startups Astroscale and ClearSpace for a mission to remove two spacecraft from low Earth orbit in 2026.

title: Brace for impact: DART successfully slams into asteroid
summary: NASA and Johns Hopkins teams have successfully tested the world’s first dedicated planetary defense mission: the Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART). DART impacted Dimorphos, a moonlet of near-Earth asteroid 65803 Didymos, at 7:14 PM EDT (23:14 UTC) on Monday, September 26, while traveling at an approximate speed of 22,000 kilometers per hour.

title: Hurricane Ian prompts NASA to move Artemis moon rocket back to its hangar
summary: Faced with threatening weather from Hurricane Ian, NASA managers decided Monday to haul the $4.1 billion Artemis 1 rocket off its launch pad and back to the protection of the agency’s Vehicle Assembly Building, likely ending any chance of launching the unpiloted moonshot before November.

title: NASA makes the call to protect its Artemis I mission from Hurricane Ian
summary: "The decision allows time for employees to address the needs of their families."
